intro: Diodia virginiana var. hirsuta, commonly known as hairy false pennyroyal, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of tiny white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its hairy foliage and distinctive scent make it easily identifiable in its natural habitat. It is often found in the understory of forests and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
